Page.title: Inspection report for the registration/renewal of registration of a child and youth care centre

sap.ui.layout.form:FormElement.label: Name of Child and Youth Care Centre
Physical address
Postal Code
Postal address
Name of person or body who manages the Child and Youth Care Centre or who wishes to establish it
Physical address of person or body:
Tel No
Cell No
Fax number
E-mail
Accreditation Reference Number

Is the centre and administration of the centre controlled by a constitution or domestic rules, and is the management constituted in accordance with the constitution? (The constitution of the centre must be submitted to the organization when the application for registration is made
Competency of management to give guidance in respect of treatment, care, training and control of children, recruiting, selection and training of staff and the general administration of the centre
Duration of office bearers to occupy the office
Last date of the AGM meeting
Are the following records and registers kept efficiently? (Answer Yes or No)
General office records (with index)
Admission registers in respect of Committed children
Admission registers in respect of Non- committed children
Daily attendance registers in respect of Committed children
Daily attendance registers in respect of Non-committed children
Separate record file and social file in respect of each child
General office records (with index)
Punishment book
Register of absconders
Store registers
Incident/accident registers
Donations book
Visitors book
Host parents/ volunteers
Any other registers (state e.g. asset register, medical register, school progress, daily happenings, etc)
Is the Child and Youth Care Centre in possession of a Children’s Act 38 of 2005 and regulations?
Are the following documents regularly submitted to the Department? If not, state reasons why not?
Statements in respect of absence of children
Monthly and annual statistics
Audited Financial Statements
Impressions regarding the efficiency of organization and general administration
Financial position: (If audited financial statements are attached, it is not necessary to complete this paragraph)
Expenditure
Direct maintenance costs (feeding, clothing and health services) and percentage of total expenditure
Costs in respect of staffing and percentage of total expenditure
Capital expenditure (excluding interests on loans, purchase of equipment and depreciation) and percentage of total expenditure
Income
From official sources
From private sources
Assets and liabilities
Book value of grounds, buildings and mortgages
Book of value of farms (fixed property) and mortgages
Investments (building societies, shares, etc)
Book debts (excluding mortgages)
Bank balance (credit or debit balance)
Balance of income and expenditure account (deficit or surplus)
General impression of financial position, e.g. whether financial position is sound
Provide details regarding the programme or programmes to be offered
Total number of children that will be accommodated
Babies/toddlers (age group)
Boys (age group)
Girls (age group)
Neglected and abused children
Children with substance abuse challenges
Children with behaviour challenges
Children with developmental or psychological disabilities
Children with physical disabilities (also state nature)
Children that in conflict with the law
Children that sentenced
Abandoned children
Children previously living on the street
General office records (with index)
Arrangements for medical and dental care
Arrangements for education
Arrangements for religious practices

Location of Child and Youth Care Centre with regard to environment, accessibility of churches, schools, hospitals, railway station, etc and availability of public amenities such as sports ground, swimming bath, etc
Grounds with regards to the area, neatness, facilities for recreation, hobbies, gardening, etc
Equipment with regards to suitability, adequacy, neatness of equipments and kitchen, bedrooms, dining rooms and living rooms

General impression in connection with establishment with regards to ratio of supervisory staff to number of children, adequacy and competency; recruiting, selection and training, conditions of service, etc
Food with regards to adequacy, suitability, preparation, balanced diet, etc
Clothing with regards to adequacy, suitability, general appearance of children as to neatness
Discipline and punishment with regard to systems of domestic rules, self- government, methods of punishment; by whom punishment is administered, etc
Extent and treatment of problems, Do the following problems occur?
Neurotic behavior problems
Uncontrollability
Child anxiety
Nocturnal enuresis
Absconding
Vandalistic tendencies
Sexual misconduct
Other (Specify)
What methods of treatment are being applied? (furnish particulars)
Are you of the opinion that the methods of treatment applied are efficient?
How many children have been transferred during the past year to other CYCC’s owing to unmanageable behavior problems?
Visits, contact with community institutions such as churches, schools and sports organization
Communication (letters/telephones etc)
Pocket money
Exercising of the principles of freedom
Policy in respect of placing children. Extent to which section? is applied in respect of extension of orders
Are absconders from the Child and Youth Care Centre brought before the presiding officer and are Social workers notified of the readmission
Is notice of movement readily submitted and properly so that it may serve a useful purpose?
Impression of the inspecting officer after interviews with children

Reunification services with regard to the part played by the Child and Youth Care Centre and the designated Social Worker, e.g. contact with the parents or supervisor, interest taken by parents (Section 187)
Any other aspect not covered by the preceding questions
(Please include in your recommendation age and gender of the children, capacity, type of children: Full / conditional registration
